title: Governor General of Australia Samantha Joy Mostyn to arrive in Sri Lanka today
byline: The Governor General of Australia Samantha Joy Mostyn is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka today on an official visit.

title: Several spells of light showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-Western provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today (06), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: UN official says Israel expanding Gaza operations would risk ‘catastrophic consequences’
byline: A top UN official has warned there would be “catastrophic consequences” if Israel expands its military operations in Gaza, after reports Israel’s Prime Minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, is pushing for a total reoccupation of the strip.

title: Trump administration terminates mRNA vaccine contracts, casting safety doubts
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration on Tuesday announced it would terminate 22 federal contracts for mRNA-based vaccines, questioning the safety of a technology credited with helping end the COVID-19 pandemic and saving millions of lives.

title: 133,000 new vehicles registered in Sri Lanka since January
byline: A total of 133,678 new vehicles have been registered in Sri Lanka since January, according to the Commissioner General of Motor Traffic, Kamal Amarasinghe, who was commenting on recent trends in vehicle registration in the country.

title: Gautam Adani steps down from executive role at ports unit
byline: India’s infrastructure tycoon Gautam Adani has stepped down from his executive position at his group’s most valuable company, Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone, no longer serving as a key managerial figure.

title: China reports 7,000 Chikungunya cases
byline: China is a facing a major chikungunya outbreak with over 7,000 cases of the mosquito-borne virus reported in the Guangdong province.

title: Aravinda Senarath steps down as COPA Chairman
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) Member of Parliament Aravinda Senarath has announced that he is stepping down as the Chairman of the Committee on Public Accounts (COPA).

title: Resolution passed in Parliament to remove Deshabandu Tennakoon from IGP post forwarded to President
byline: The resolution which was passed in Parliament yesterday to remove Deshabandu Tennakoon from the post of IGP has been forwarded to the President by the Speaker, the Office of the Parliament Secretary-General said.

title: Revoking privileges of Ex- Presidents, more about political revenge than policy: MR
byline: The present government is revoking the privileges of former presidents out of a sense of revenge rather than real policy, according to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa.

title: Bangladesh announces election as country marks year since ex-PM fled
byline: Bangladesh will hold its first elections since protests toppled its former prime minister next February, the country’s interim leader said on the anniversary of her overthrow.

title: Arkia – Israeli Airline to resume Tel Aviv-Colombo flights in Sep. 2025
byline: Arkia – Israeli Airlines from September 2025 plans to resume service to Sri Lanka, last served until May 2024.

title: 78-year-old arrested with stock of explosives in Rakwana
byline: A 78-year-old individual, a resident of Rakwana has been arrested in Medagangoda for the illegal possession of a large quantity of commercial explosives.

title: Tuition classes targeting 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship exam banned from midnight
byline: The conduct of tuition classes, seminars, and other workshops targeting the 2025 Grade Five Scholarship Examination is banned from midnight today (Aug 06) until the conclusion of the exam.

title: 120 foreigners obtain temporary driving licenses at BIA service counter
byline: A total of 120 foreign nationals have been issued temporary driving licenses through the newly established service counter at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake since its launch on August 3, the Commissioner General of Motor Traffic, Kamal Amarasinghe states.

title: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa arrested
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC), a short while ago.

title: GMOA threatens to strike next week
byline: The Central Committee of the Government Medical Officers’ Association has decided to launch an island-wide strike based on several demands, including the implementation of doctors’ transfers, Dr. Hansamal Weerasuriya, the Assistant Secretary of the GMOA stated.

title: Six dead in five separate road accidents across Sri Lanka
byline: Six individuals, including four youth, have died in five separate road accidents reported from various parts of the island.

title: Sagala Ratnayaka arrives at FCID
byline: Former Chief of Staff of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe Sagala Ratnayaka has arrived at the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID).

title: WhatsApp deletes over 6.8m accounts linked to scams, Meta says
byline: WhatsApp has taken down 6.8 million accounts linked to scammers targeting people around the world in the first half of this year, its parent company Meta says.

title: Second reading of Sri Lanka Electricity (Amendment) Bill in Parliament today
byline: The second reading of the Sri Lanka Electricity (Amendment) Bill is scheduled to take place in Parliament today.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ combs seeking Trump pardon: Lawyer
byline: Music mogul Sean “Diddy” Combs, who is to be sentenced in October for his conviction on prostitution-related charges, is seeking a pardon from President Donald Trump, one of his lawyers said Tuesday.

title: Tourism Dy Minister clarifies Minister Vijitha Herath’s statement on tourism earnings
byline: Deputy Minister of Tourism Ruwan Ranasingha has provided clarification regarding a statement made by the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath who claimed that an income of USD 3.7 billion had been earned from tourist arrivals since January 1, 2025.

title: No special security for Israeli nationals in Sri Lanka – Cabinet Spokesman
byline: No special security has been given to Israeli nationals currently in Sri Lanka as tourists, according to Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa.

title: US DOJ to open grand jury to investigate Obama officials, source says
byline: U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi has directed federal prosecutors to launch a grand jury investigation into allegations that members of Democratic former President Barack Obama’s administration manufactured intelligence on Russia’s interference in the 2016 elections, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday.

title: Resolution to remove Deshabandu Tennakoon from office to be debated in Parliament today
byline: The resolution to remove Inspector General of Police Deshabandu Tennakoon from office in terms of Section 17 of the Removal of Officers (Procedure) Act, No. 5 of 2002, will be taken up for debate in Parliament today.

title: Trump threatens India with ‘substantial’ tariff hike for buying Russian oil
byline: Donald Trump has threatened to “substantially” raise tariffs against India over its purchase of oil from Russia.

title: Kerala cannabis valued over Rs. 23 million seized in Jaffna
byline: A stock of 102 kilograms and 700 grams of Kerala cannabis has been seized by the Sri Lanka Navy during a search operation conducted in Kadeikadu, Jaffna.

title: Over 3,500 armed forces deserters arrested, says Defense Ministry
byline: More than 3,500 tri-forces personnel who had abandoned the service without obtaining legal discharge have been apprehended, the Ministry of Defense has announced.

title: US condemns house arrest of Brazil’s ex-president Jair Bolsonaro
byline: Brazil’s Supreme Court has ordered that the former right-wing President Jair Bolsonaro be put under house arrest.

title: Indictments served on ‘Harak Kata’ and four others in new case at Colombo HC
byline: The Attorney General has filed a new case before the Colombo High Court against five individuals, including Nadun Chinthaka Wickramaratne, alias “Harak Kata,” on 50 charges, including conspiracy to escape from the custody of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) while in detention.

title: Thebuwana Bindu arrested with ‘Ice’ worth Rs. 5 million
byline: An individual known as “Thebuwana Bindu,” who had been operating a drug trafficking network via the “eZ Cash” system, has been arrested by the Thebuwana Police.

title: PUCSL conducts public hearing into nationwide power outage
byline: The public hearing conducted by the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) regarding the nationwide power outage that occurred on February 9, 2025, commenced this morning (05).

title: Visa applicants may be required to post bond of up to 15,000 USD to enter U.S.
byline: The U.S. State Department is set to roll out a pilot program that may require foreign nationals seeking business or tourism visas to post a bond of up to 15,000 U.S. dollars to enter the United States, according to a preview of a bond notice posted on the Federal Register website on Monday.

title: Cabinet approves proposal to appoint new Delimitation Committee
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to appoint a new Delimitation Committee to review recommendations of the committees appointed in 2012 and 2021 and to provide further recommendations.

title: “No threat to National Security”: Defence Secretary
byline: There is currently no threat to national security, says the Secretary of the Ministry of Defence Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha (Retd).

title: Several senior police officers transferred due to service requirement
byline: Transfers have been granted to a group of senior police officers with the approval of the National Police Commission.

title: 11 Indian nationals arrested in Thalangama over online gambling racket
byline: A total of 11 Indian nationals have been arrested by the Thalangama Police for allegedly engaging in online gambling activities.

title: Starlink hardware now available for pre-order at Singer outlets and online
byline: US-based aerospace giant SpaceX has appointed SINGER Sri Lanka as the authorized retailer for Starlink, marking a major step toward transforming internet access in Sri Lanka.

title: Governor General of Australia Samantha Joy Mostyn to visit Sri Lanka
byline: The Governor General of Australia Samantha Joy Mostyn is scheduled to undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka tomorrow.

title: Debate on motion to remove Deshabandu Tennakoon from IGP post commences in Parliament
byline: The debate on the motion presented to remove Deshabandu Tennakoon from the post of Inspector General of Police, in terms of Section 17 of the Removal of Officers (Procedure) Act, No. 5 of 2002, commenced in Parliament a short while ago.

title: Another earthquake hits Russia’s Petropavlovsk region; back-to-back tremors raise alarm
byline: Fresh tremor of magnitude 5.1 struck far-east in Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky, Russia today, reported the US Geological Survey (USGS).

title: Indian actor Dhanush criticises AI-altered ending for re-release of hit film Raanjhanaa
byline: Indian actor Dhanush says he has been left “completely disturbed” by the re-release of one of his hit films with an alternative ending assisted by AI - but the production company behind it has rejected criticism of the move.

title: 703 individuals arrested during special island-wide police raids
byline: A total of 703 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (04).

title: MPs’ Rs. 1 million insurance coverage to be slashed
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the proposal submitted by the Minister of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs to reduce the insurance coverage limit granted for Members of Parliament from Rs. 1 million to Rs. 250,000.

title: Govt to grant free access to 26 archaeological sites for children under 18
byline: The government has decided to grant free admission to children under the age of 18 to sites managed by the Central Cultural Fund (CCF).

title: Another short day today; experts rush to find why Earth is speeding up
byline: Earth is spinning faster than usual, and scientists are still unsure why.

title: Prices of luxury watches in US rise after Trump’s Swiss tariffs
byline: Switzerland’s watch industry is facing a threat to sales after Donald Trump said he would impose 39 per cent tariffs on the country, raising the prospect of significantly higher prices in one of its biggest markets.

title: South Korea pledges to help companies cope with higher US tariffs
byline: South Korea will prepare measures to help companies cope with higher U.S. tariffs and expand into new markets, the Finance Ministry said on Tuesday, as it kicked off a task force to prepare the new administration’s economic policy plans.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall above 50mm expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-Western provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today (05), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Indian airports on high alert over possible terror threat
byline: The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security has placed all Indian airports on maximum alert following intelligence inputs warning of potential threats from terrorists or “anti-social elements” between September 22 and October 2, 2025.

title: Colombo HC orders CID Director to produce documents related to separate carrom board case
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered the CID Director to produce documents related to the case filed by the Attorney General against former Ministers Mahindananda Aluthgamage and Nalin Fernando, who are currently serving prison sentences.

title: Second reading debate of Electricity (Amendment) Bill in Parliament today
byline: The second reading of the Sri Lanka Electricity (Amendment) Bill is scheduled to take place in Parliament today.
